title: React Counter Component
description: Create a simple React counter component with increment and decrement buttons. The component will be a functional component using hooks, styled with CSS modules. It will include a reset button and conditionally style the counter display based on its value (red when negative, green when positive). Basic documentation will also be added.

steps.title: Set up project
steps.description: Create a new React project using Create React App. Remove unnecessary boilerplate files and code.

steps.title: Create Counter component
steps.description: Create a new functional component called Counter. Use the useState hook to manage the counter state.

steps.title: Implement increment and decrement buttons
steps.description: Add increment and decrement buttons to the Counter component. Use the onClick event to update the counter state accordingly.

steps.title: Add reset button
steps.description: Implement a reset button that sets the counter state back to 0 when clicked.

steps.title: Style Counter component with CSS modules
steps.description: Create a CSS module for the Counter component. Style the counter display, increment, decrement, and reset buttons.

steps.title: Conditionally style counter display
steps.description: Update the counter display styling based on its value. Use the className property to conditionally apply CSS classes for negative (red) and positive (green) values.

steps.title: Test Counter component
steps.description: Write unit tests for the Counter component to ensure it functions as expected. Test increment, decrement, reset functionality, and conditional styling.

steps.title: Add documentation
steps.description: Create a README file with basic documentation on how to use and customize the Counter component.

revisionReason: The plan was revised to address dependency issues. Step-2 was added to create the basic structure of the Counter component, which is crucial for subsequent steps. The steps were reordered based on their dependencies to ensure a logical progression and unblock the plan. The dependencies of each step were updated accordingly.
